job_description: Researcher (artificial intelligence applications in welfare technology and digital services for the social participation of young people), two fixed-term positionsTampere University and Tampere University of Applied Sciences create a unique environment for multidisciplinary, inspirational and high-impact research and education. Our universities community has its competitive edges in technology, health and society. www.tuni.fi/en The researcher becomes a member of Human-Centered Technology (IHTE) research group, which focuses on design research for new technologies and digital applications. The groupâs aim is to improve people's quality of life and to promote the sustainable development of society through research, the results of which can be used to develop new technological solutions for various application areas. The research is multidisciplinary in nature and includes both practical and theoretical perspectives.The IHTE research group is part of Computing Sciences unit, whose research is characterized by IT-related business collaboration and the application of research results in practice. The unit belongs to the Faculty of Information Technology and Communication Sciences of the University of Tampere.Description of the positionsThere are a total of two fixed-term positions to be applied for in two research projects: 1) AI Hub Tampere - artificial intelligence (AI) applications for well-being and health, and 2) ALL-YOUTH - digital services for the social participation of young people. Below are brief descriptions of the project topics and key tasks of the researchers.1) AI Hub Tampere - well-being and health related AI applications, duration approx. 1.5 yearsThe AI Hub project  develops, among other things, well-being and health related AI applications and their design methods together with companies in Pirkanmaa. The aim of the project is to facilitate the application of digitalisation using artificial intelligence in the healthcare sector. We approach the issue from a human-centered design perspective, aiming to increase the trust and transparency of AI, maintain people's autonomy in the deployment of AI, and ensure the accessibility, smoothness and sustainability of services. The work is done on the basis of the needs of companies in Pirkanmaa region by mapping their needs related to AI, and by organizing workshops and short research periods with companies. The topics of the research depend on the needs of the companies, but they can be related to, for example, the development of AI that supports the well-being of employees or the development of the interaction of a robot working in healthcare. The project involves several research groups at the University of Tampere, e.g. in the fields of AI, information technology and robotics.Key tasks of the researcher in the AI Hub project:Determining business needs in the area of well-being and health artificial intelligence applicationsUser and business research on well-being and health artificial intelligence applicationsBusiness cooperation; planning, organizing and conducting studies and workshops with the various actors in the projectHuman-centered design of artificial intelligence applications - concept design and user interface design and their evaluation by end usersWriting publications and communication on project resultsIn addition, the selected person may have separately agreed project management tasks, communication tasks or teaching tasks in the topic of human-centered design.2) ALL-YOUTH - digital services for the social participation of young people, duration approx. 1 year 3 monthsYoung people want to rule their lives (ALL-YOUTH) is a multidisciplinary project that examines the abilities and barriers to the social participation of young people aged 16-25 and their perceptions of sustainable development, growth and well-being. The project will bring together new solutions for more active citizenship of young people from the perspectives of interactive governance and the rule of law, digital innovation, sustainable development and the bioeconomy. The Research Group on Human-Centered Technology at the University of Tampere is researching and developing digital ways to support the social participation of young people. The project has developed a web-based prototype of the civic council service âVirtual Councilâ, based on cooperation with Ministry of Justice and the Finnish Red Cross.Key tasks of the researcher in the ALL-YOUTH project:User surveys on digital participation services, in particular on the use and further development of Virtual Council serviceHuman-centered design and evaluation of new digital participation service concepts by end usersCollaborative research with a multidisciplinary research team and presentation of resultsWriting publications and communication on project resultsIn addition, the person selected for the position may have separately agreed teaching assignments in the topic of human-centered design.RequirementsBoth positions require a suitable Masterâs degree in related fields, such as human-technology interaction, information technology, computer science, service design or psychology.The following knowledge and skills are required in both positions:Ability and motivation for independent research work in a research projectMethods of human-centered design, e.g. interviews, observations, participatory workshops and concept design, and application of methods to the research objectiveQualitative and quantitative methods of analysis (at least the basics)Very good communication and collaboration skills with different actors (business representatives, stakeholders, end users, multidisciplinary project team)Very good spoken and written English language skillsIn addition, the following are considered to be advantages:In both projects: experience in scientific research and writing; good command of the Finnish language (for example, can do user research in Finnish)AI Hub: knowledge or previous experience in the application of AI or the design of wellness or health technologies; experience in business cooperation; workshop facilitation skillsALL-YOUTH: knowledge of digital service design; experience in multidisciplinary cooperation; interest in social influenceTampere University is a unique, multidisciplinary and boldly forward-looking, evolving community. Our values are openness, diversity, responsibility, courage, critical thinking, erudition/ Bildung, and learner-centredness. We hope that you can embrace these values and promote them in your work.We offerWe offer an inspiring and good-natured work community at the University of Tampere. The research group of Human-Centered Technology (IHTE) is diverse and cultural and actively participates in the development of the university. IHTE operates on the Hervanta campus.Depending on the profile of the selected person, work might offer an opportunity to conduct research for doctoral dissertation. This requires both the consent of the supervisor and gaining the study right to postgraduate studies at the Faculty of Information Technology and Communication Sciences at the University of Tampere.The tasks described in this call are primarily full-time, but part-time work may also be possible. The tasks will be filled for a fixed period as follows:AI Hub: from March or April 2022, for about 1.5 yearsALL-YOUTH: from March or April 2022, for about 1 year 3 monthsThere is some flexibility in the start times, depending on the situations of the successful applicants.There is a 6-month probationary period.The salary will be based on both the job requirements and the employee's personal performance in accordance with the Finnish University Salary System.
